comments.body: PostgreSQL 9.3 and earlier versions are no longer maintained. Do we really need such conditions in new modules?
I'm afraid CI tests will fail because they use even 9.0. Anyway it's not difficult to implement this, so I suggest to remain this condition.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +266,270 @@                              "AND column_name = 'spcoptions'", add_to_executed=False)

        # For 9.1 version and earlier:
        location = self.__exec_sql("SELECT 1 FROM information_schema.columns "
                                   "WHERE table_name = 'pg_tablespace' "

comments.body: Just curious why you're using the where condition here and not in the sql statement above?
as i remember, it doesn't work if you have %s and %(blabla)s in the same row in one instruction

```
Python 3.6.6 (default, Mar 29 2019, 00:03:27) 
[GCC 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-36)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> s = "%s %(blabla)s" % 'first'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: format requires a mapping
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +256,260 @@                     "ON t.spcowner = r.oid " % location)

        res = exec_sql(self, query + "WHERE t.spcname = %(name)s",
                       query_params={'name': self.name}, add_to_executed=False)
